intro: Erucastrum benacense, commonly known as the Mediterranean wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It produces small, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a peppery flavor, making it a potential candidate for culinary use.
